DataElement.preferredName: Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire 1 How Often Week Strenuous Exercise Greater Than Fifteen Minute Performed Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric value that represents the number of times per week an individual performed strenuous exercise for more than fifteen minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire How Often Week Strenuous Exercise Greater Than Fifteen Minute Performed Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A short self-report questionnaire used to identify the leisure-time physical activities of adults._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._Any period of seven consecutive days._Requiring high effort, energy, or strength._Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than 14 and less than 16 and the quantity that it denotes._A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._Executed and carried through to completion._A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A short self-report questionnaire used to identify the leisure-time physical activities of adults.

Concepts.definition: A short self-report questionnaire used to identify the leisure-time physical activities of adults.

Property.preferredName: How Often Week Strenuous Exercise Greater Than Fifteen Minute Performed Number
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Requiring high effort, energy, or strength.:Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A natural number greater than 14 and less than 16 and the quantity that it denotes.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Requiring high effort, energy, or strength.
Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 14 and less than 16 and the quantity that it denotes.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance per K. Laumann

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Number value to represent the number of times an activity occurred during the timespan of one week.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: STRENUOUS EXERCISE  (HEART BE
ReferenceDocuments.description: STRENUOUS EXERCISE  (HEART BEATS RAPIDLY) (e.g., running, jogging, hockey, football, soccer, squash, basketball, cross country skiing, judo, roller skating, vigorous swimming, vigorous long distance bicycling)
